attributes.action: Government Ministers and MPs should stop referring to "The will of the people".
attributes.additional_details:
Views on the current deal before parliament:
https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-50123223
Views on Brexit:
https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-50043549
Poll tracker:
https://whatukthinks.org/eu/questions/if-there-was-a-referendum-on-britains-membership-of-the-eu-how-would-you-vote-2/
attributes.background:
The referendum that took place in 2016 was closely run with a small majority in favour of leaving the EU. 
Since then, polls have shown that the view of the people is changing, or is at least unknown. 
Therefore "The will of the people" is not a phrase that should be used by public officials.

rejection.details: This would be a decision for individual MP's and not the UK Government or Parliament as a whole.
